channel.title: TheSocialWeb.tv
channel.description: Why don't the social networks and communication tools you use work well together? Tune in each week to learn about the progress being made toward opening up the Social Web. With a revolving cast of characters, we'll have some of the key technologists working on building the Social Web to explain what is going on; but this isn't a show about technology. It's about explaining what's going on in the fight to make sure you have control of your data, your content, and your privacy -- and the freedom to access your stuff from all over the Web.

item.title: Episode 20: "Yahoo Ups the Ante for Online Identity"
item.dc:creator: John McCrea, David Recordon, and Joseph Smarr
item.content:encoded:
Episode 20: "Yahoo Ups the Ante for Online Identity"

John and Joseph cover another busy week for opening up the Social Web with a primary focus on Yahoo's latest iteration of their implementation of OpenID. In a test release that went live today between Yahoo and Plaxo, new users can sign up for Plaxo with their Yahoo OpenID and choose to bring over their basic profile info. John and Joseph give a "magical" demo of this much-improved onboarding flow.

item.title: Episode 18: "Live at the Internet Identity Workshop"
item.dc:creator: John McCrea, David Recordon, and Joseph Smarr
item.content:encoded:
Episode 18: "Live at the Internet Identity Workshop"

John, Joseph, and David kickoff a "double header" week with an episode shot on location at the Internet Identity Workshop at the Computer History Museum in Mountain View. Special guests include: Max Engel of MySpace, Eran Hammer of Yahoo, Dick Hardt of Sxipper, Paul Trevithick of Parity, and Doc Searls of the Berkman Center for Internet and Society. Plus, you can see a working Babbage Engine (a Victorian computer) in the background, and some amazing video editing work. Props to Redgee!

item.title: Episode 16: "OpenID's Historic Week: Microsoft and Google Go Live"
item.dc:creator: John McCrea, David Recordon, and Joseph Smarr
item.content:encoded:
Episode 16: "OpenID's Historic Week: Microsoft and Google Go Live"

In what will likely be remembered as an historic week for OpenID and for opening up the Social Web, John, David, and Joseph take the show on the road, over to Google headquarters. Special guest Eric Sachs, from the Google's Security Team, shares the backstory behind Google becoming an OpenID provider and talks about how he sees OpenID and OAuth fitting together to solve problems on the Web and in the enterprise. Since we shot this episode yesterday, Google has now removed their whitelist meaning that any OpenID site can use their OpenID Provider.

item.title: Episode 14: "Mashin' it up with Mashery"
item.dc:creator: John McCrea, David Recordon, and Joseph Smarr
item.content:encoded:
Episode 14: "Mashin' it up with Mashery"

John and Chris host special guest Clay Loveless, Mashery's chief architect. Topics include: Key sessions at FOWA, recent usability studies for OpenID (and how the "open stack" team is responding), and Mashery's behind-the-scenes role in launching APIs for New York Times, Netflix, Best Buy, and MTV. Things to watch for: John's voice cracking (twice), mysterious arm gestures in the background, and our first "Pailin moment"!

item.title: Episode 12: "Netflix Opens Up"
item.dc:creator: John McCrea, David Recordon, and Joseph Smarr
item.content:encoded:
Episode 12: "Netflix Opens Up"

David and Joseph are back from the East Coast to join John for a discussion with special guest Michael Hart from Netflix on the day after Netflix released its much anticipated API. Discussion also includes Mashery, a company that's becoming a key part of the new open Social Web ecosystem, providing API support to mainstream companies, like Netflix, Best Buy, and MTV.
